intro: Acinodendron sanguineum, commonly known as the bloodwood tree, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive red or pink bark, which gives it its common name. The tree can grow up to 15 meters tall, with a dense canopy and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically white or pale pink, and it produces small, round fruits that contain a single seed. The plant is often found in dry forests and savannas, adapting well to arid conditions.
